intro: Cotula dichrocephaloides, commonly known as the two-headed cotula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a head. Cotula dichrocephaloides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
